(b) Excess demand functions for both goods: z1(p) = (xa 1 + xb 1) − (wa 1 + wb 1) z2(p) = (xa 2 + xb 2) − (wa 2 + wb 2) (c) Walras’ Law: p · z(p) = 0 for all p. Budget constraint for a, substituting in solutions from (a): p1(8 − 20) + p2(8 − 0) = 0 Similarly for b: p1(12 − 0) + p2(4 − 12) = 0 Adding together gives: (12 − 12)p1 + (8 − 8)p2 = 0 The sum of the values of excess demands equals zero, for all prices. ∴ Walrus’ Law holds.
